Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Heritrix is based on the notion of accurately capturing websites (i.e.
with=
out any modifications of downloaded content). The functionality you are
ask=
ing for has not been included. It would probably be possible to write a
pro=
cessor for this, however I don't know of anyone working on that.
 
Might I =
suggest that you try HTTrack (http://www.httrack.com/) instead of
Heritrix.=
 Unlike Heritrix, HTTrack is designed for mirroring websites, which
include=
s rewriting those links. I think it might be more suitable to your
purposes=
.
 
- Kris

-----Original Message-----
From: archive-crawler@...=
m
[mailto:archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of lbalan12
Sent: 11. =
ma=ED 2005 08:00
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [archive-craw=
ler] Changing absolute URL to relative


Dear Heritrix users,

I am a libra=
rian in HKUST library and I just try to use Heritrix as
the web crawler. I =
have one question.

How can I set up so that all the absolute links in the =
target website
will become relative ones in the downloaded version?

e.g. 1=


Change: absolute URL

  href=3D"http://www.yahoo.com/mytopic/test1.html"
=

To: relative URL (

  href=3D"mytopic/test1.html"

e.g. 2

Change: absolut=
e URL

  href=3D"/mytopic/test2.html"

To: relative URL (

  href=3D"mytopi=
c/test2.html"

Since I want to put the downloaded website into a CDROM, so =
all the
links must be relative so that they won't point 'outside' the CDROM=

and stay within the CDROM.

Your ideas and suggestions are important becau=
se I don't know where to
start with!

Thanks a lot!

Alan Ng
HKUST Library
=
May 11
